name: Path N Vagina
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and regional lymph node detail are available, use the regional lymph node detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage - see Registrar notes.
* If the only information is (pathologic) FIGO III, assign the appropriate stage and leave pathologic T, N, and M blank. If the only information is (pathologic) FIGO stage IVB, leave pathologic T and N blank and see M

**Note 2:** Histological examination of an inguinal lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes; a pelvic lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (FIGO classifies such cases as pNX). (1)

**Note 3:** Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).  

**Regional lymph nodes**

    Upper two thirds of vagina, regional nodes
       Pelvic lymph nodes
           Iliac, NOS
              Common
              External
               Internal (hypogastric)
                   Obturator
                   Middle sacral (promontorial) (Gerota's node)
       Pelvic lymph node(s), NOS

    Lower third of vagina, regional nodes
       Ipsilateral or bilateral
          Inguinal, NOS
             Superficial inguinal (femoral)
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 204
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Pathologic classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    Physician unable to assess N
    Surgical resection primary tumor, no regional lymph nodes removed OR
    Involvement of regional lymph nodes not documented
Physician assign pNX, no other information available to determine N
Only information available is FIGO Stage I or II

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Clinically: No regional lymph node metastasis
Use only for TNM defined pTis cases where there is a resection of the primary and the nodes are not evaluated pathologically

Primary site/histology not TNM defined
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Only information is FIGO Stage III or IVB

Pathologic classification not met
No surgical resection of primary tumor AND
There isn't a positive biopsy of a structure in the highest T category and highest N category
Evidence of metastatic disease (pM1), no other workup
